item.itunes:author: Emmanuel Goldstein
item.author: otw@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein)
item.itunes:summary: Off The Wall show for June 5, 2012
item.title: Off The Wall show for June 5, 2012

item.description: It was Friday, June 5, 1987 when we held the very first 2600 meeting at what was then known as the Citicorp Center in New York City. The meeting was modeled after the weekly "TAP" meetings which had been taking place in New York for many years, organized by the phone phreak newsletter which published from the early 1970s to 1983. We had a number of people turn up and it was decided that the meetings should continue. They eventually would expand into cities all over the world and the first Friday of the month became known as "2600 Meeting Day" amongst hackers, law enforcement agencies, and corporate boards everywhere.
item.title: 25TH ANNIVERSARY OF FIRST 2600 MEETING FRIDAY

item.description: It's currently the last day of May, which means that it's the last day for potential speakers at this year's HOPE conference to send in their submissions. Because of the huge number of entries this year, we cannot extend this deadline. After midnight (Eastern Daylight Time), we will no longer be accepting speaker submissions. So if you plan on giving a talk or throwing together a panel discussion, we suggest you drop whatever you're doing and put together an email that outlines your proposal, and send that on in to speakers@hope.net. You can find a list of guidelines here.
item.title: REMINDER: HOPE SPEAKER SUBMISSION DEADLINE TODAY

item.itunes:author: Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.
item.author: oth@2600.com (Emmanuel Goldstein et.al.)
item.itunes:summary: Off The Hook show for May 30, 2012
item.title: Off The Hook show for May 30, 2012

item.description: To anyone who may have been procrastinating about submitting a kickass talk or panel proposal to the HOPE Number Nine speaker committee at speakers@hope.net, please be advised that our final deadline is Thursday, May 31.
item.title: REMINDER: SPEAKER SUBMISSION DEADLINE LOOMING FOR HOPE NUMBER NINE

item.description: We've begun work on the 2013 Hacker Calendar after a really good response to the 2012 edition. This time the theme is surveillance, something near and dear to all of us.
item.title: HELP US COMPILE THE 2013 HACKER CALENDAR

item.description: The Spring issue of 2600 has been officially released in digital and paper versions worldwide. If you're a subscriber, you likely already have gotten the Spring issue delivered to you. If not, it should be in your hands really soon. For those of you who get 2600 at bookstores or newsstands, you can start planning your trip to those places now, as we believe the issues are already on the stands. For those of you in the electronic world, your issues will be ready in a matter of seconds, or even less if you've got a Kindle subscription, as your copy will have already been magically beamed to your Kindle device. We're still trying to get on the Barnes and Noble subscription list, but until that happens, you can pick up individual issues on their site.
item.title: SPRING ISSUE OF 2600 RELEASED

item.description: So we've taken the next step in our digital publishing project. We've gone all the way back to 1984, our first year publishing, and put together "The Hacker Digest - Volume 1" for Kindles, Nooks, tablets, computers, the works. It's all DRM-free as well.
item.title: VOLUME 1 OF 2600 NOW ONLINE - DRM FREE - IN KINDLE, NOOK, AND PDF FORMATS

item.description: For the entire month of April, we will be donating ten percent of the amount brought in from HOPE ticket sales to the Electronic Frontier Foundation.
item.title: HOPE TICKET SALES TO BENEFIT ELECTRONIC FRONTIER FOUNDATION

item.description: We will have a live interview with Richard O'Dwyer's mother on tonight's edition of "Off The Hook," to be aired at 7 pm ET over WBAI-FM and online.
item.title: RICHARD O'DWYER STORY TO BE FEATURED ON 'OFF THE HOOK'
